meanings.definition: To bring back into service or use after a period of inactivity.
meanings.sent1: After years of neglect, the team finally recommisioned the old factory.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to recommision the outdated machinery for production.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy robot woke up after recommisioning and started dancing.
meanings.sent4: The town recommisioned the abandoned building, breathing new life into it.
meanings.sent5: Recommissioning the vintage car made it roar back to life with a purr.

meanings.definition: The act of restoring a piece of equipment or machinery to working condition.
meanings.sent1: The recommisioning of the broken generator saved the day.
meanings.sent2: The recommisioning process required skilled technicians to complete.
meanings.sent3: The magical touch of recommisioning turned the rusty gears smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The recommisioning of the old printer made it work like new again.
meanings.sent5: The recommisioning of the engine brought back its power and efficiency.

meanings.definition: The process of reevaluating and updating a plan or strategy for future use.
meanings.sent1: The recommisioning of the business model led to increased profits.
meanings.sent2: The recommisioning of the project timeline ensured timely completion.
meanings.sent3: The team's recommisioning of the marketing strategy sparked creativity.
meanings.sent4: After recommisioning the budget, the company found new cost-saving measures.
meanings.sent5: Recommissioning the roadmap helped the team navigate towards success.
